Description: Limestone ostracon: on recto and verso respectively seventeen and sixteen lines of a continuous text describing the trial and condemnation of the woman Heria accused of stealing a workman's spike, and subsequent report to the vizier.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: K. Kitchen, 'Ramesside Inscriptions' IV (Oxford, 1982), 315-17; A.G. McDowell, 'Jurisdiction in the Workmen's Community of Deir el-Medina' (Leiden, 1990), pp.156-7; 'idem', 'Village life in Ancient Egypt' (Oxford, 1999), pp.186-8, no.144; S. Allam, 'Hieratische Ostraka und Papyri aus der Ramessidenzeit' (Tubingen, 1973), no.217, pp. 214-17; J. J. Černy and A.H. Gardiner, ‘Hieratic Ostraca’ (Oxford 1957), pl. 46.2.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (136393) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/136393)
